title: 9 killed in renewed drug war
text:
9 killed in renewed drug war By Ric Sapnu, Ramon Efren Lazaro, Cecille Suerte Felipe, Gilbert Bayoran, Eva Visperas and Francis Elevado   
Tricycle driver Elmer Pangsanjan, 41, alias Whitey, a resident of Barangay San Juan; Francis Bondoc of Kaingin both in Malolos City and Michael Maglanque of Tigpalas in San Miguel town reportedly shot it out with police operatives and agents of the Philippine Drug Enforcement Agency yesterday. AP/Aaron Favila 
MANILA, Philippines - Nine more suspects were killed in Bulacan in the past two days as the police rejoined what it promised to be a less bloody campaign against illegal drugs. 
Tricycle driver Elmer Pangsanjan, 41, alias Whitey, a resident of Barangay San Juan; Francis Bondoc of Kaingin both in Malolos City and Michael Maglanque of Tigpalas in San Miguel town reportedly shot it out with police operatives and agents of the Philippine Drug Enforcement Agency yesterday. 
Chief Superintendent Aaron Aquino, Central Luzon police chief, said the fatalities are on the drug watchlist in their respective barangays. 
Senior Superintendent Romeo Caramat, Bulacan police acting director, said Errol Caperal of Barangay Sumapang Matanda also in Malolos, an alias Lord of Camalig in Meycauyan, Christopher Eustaquio Batia of Bocaue, Roberto Bautista, an alias Nognog and a certain Bentong of Barangay FVR in Norzagaray were killed in separate anti-drug operations on Monday. 
Caramat said 21 other drug suspects were arrested. 
He said 85 sachets of shabu and 14 assorted guns were recovered from the suspects, including the fatalities.   Vigilante killing 
In Negros Occidental, suspected vigilantes gunned down Romie Mamilla at his residence in a remote barangay in Moises Padilla town on Monday night. 
Chief Inspector Alan Reloj, town police chief, said the victim is on the drug watchlist and tagged in a murder case. 
Four others were arrested in stings in Camarines Norte and two in Sta. Rita, Pampanga also on Monday. Sachets of shabu were reportedly recovered from the suspects. 
In Pangasinan, Cristina Balicud, 37, was arrested after a raid on her house in Barangay Poblacion in Asingan town yielded five sachets of shabu, P431,000 in cash and an improvised caliber .22 revolver. 
Police said they also recovered seven motorcycles and 30 goats believed to be stolen and sold to Balicud.
